Hi all,

I've just finished putting together a (very initial) proposal for =
an add-on
to Heritrix that would give it the ability to recrawl websites an=
d adjust to
their change frequncies.

The proposal can be found here http:/=
/vefsofnun.bok.hi.is/ar/.

All feedback, questions, comments and general gr=
umbling is welcome.

- Kris

hi,Kristinn Sigurdsson=EF=BC=8C 
 
=E3=80=80What is the purpose we=
 use a spider?=E3=80=80Mirror a site for offline browser,
or monite a favor=
ite site's update and get an alert when it changed,or 
index some kinds of =
sites to build our own search engine, or add some search
function to a stat=
ic html site...
  all the task need the crawler have the ability to re-craw=
 a site and
download
only the changed pages.I want use heritrix to build a =
search engine in my
LAN 
and can index all the sites about agriculture,so I=
 wish heritrix will do
this for
me. And I wish heritrix can run a job repea=
tedly in a certain period. So I
can add some 
site into the seed, and creat=
e a job ,then tell heritrix run this job
everyday,
and heritrix can run it =
automatically and update only the changed pages of
the sites.
  thanks all =
the developer for develop the great spider!
 
ansi
 
    
 
Right, as Mark =
said this isn=E2=80=99t present yet but is becoming a priority so
expect to=
 see a lot of work done on this in the coming months.
 
In fact I=E2=80=99l=
l be looking into doing continous repeating crawls that adapt to
change fre=
quencies. With a little luck that will be available sometime this
fall. 
 
=
I would therefor very much like to hear why you want this feature (what do
=
you hope to gain). Is it a matter of conserving disk space, bandwidht, bein=
g
polite to websites etc. Please be as verbose as you like. 
 
Feedback on =
this issue from other members of the list is of course also
welcome.
 
- Kr=
is

Copenhagen workshop (see wiki
for details). I was hoping to start looking a=
t this 
in the next week or so.

cheers 

mark
